snippet: CURTIN--Phyllis. The Metropolitan Opera mourns the death of soprano Phyllis Curtin, whose extensive career included 35 Met performances of 10 roles between 1961 and 1973, as well as hundreds of performances at New York City Opera and on other major international stages. After her retirement from the stage, Curtin became one of the industry's most sought-after and respected voice teachers. We extend our condolences to her family, friends, and admirers. Peter Gelb, General Manager James Levine, Music Director Emeritus 1/3
